sentence.Network_cn: 他用毛巾抹去余下的皂沫。

sentence.Network_en: For super-soft skin, lather on a light body lotion before you bathe.
sentence.Network_cn: 皮肤极柔嫩者，可在沐浴前涂上温和的护肤露。
像平常那样在头发上抹上洗发液。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English læthor (denoting washing soda or its froth), lēthran (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse lauthr (noun), from an Indo-European root shared by Greek loutron 'bath'

entry.def: A lather is a white mass of bubbles which is produced by mixing a substance such as soap or washing powder with water.

example.ex: ...the sort of water that easily makes a lather with soap...
example.tran: 加上肥皂会立即起泡的那种水

example.ex: He wiped off the remains of the lather with a towel.
example.tran: 他用毛巾抹去余下的皂沫。

entry.def: When a substance such as soap or washing powder lathers, it produces a white mass of bubbles because it has been mixed with water.

example.ex: The shampoo lathers and foams so much it's very hard to rinse it all out.
example.tran: 这种洗发水泡沫太多，很难冲干净。

entry.tran: 在…上涂以肥皂（或洗衣粉等）（以产生泡沫并清洗）
entry.def: If you lather something, you rub a substance such as soap or washing powder on it until a lather is produced, in order to clean it.

example.tran: 像平常那样在头发上抹上洗发液。

example.ex: For super-soft skin, lather on a light body lotion before you bathe.
example.tran: 皮肤极柔嫩者，可在沐浴前涂上温和的护肤露。

entry.def: If you say that someone works themselves up into a lather or gets in a lather about something, you think that they are getting upset, angry, or worried about it when there is no need to do so.

example.ex: You have spent the past six months working yourself up into a lather over situations which are really none of your business...
example.tran: 过去半年你一直在为压根儿和你无关的事情心急上火。

example.ex: 'I'm not going to get into a lather over this defeat,' said the manager.
example.tran: “我不会因为这次失败而不快，”经理说道。

means.word_mean: 1. the froth produced by soaps or detergents
3. a workman who puts up laths
4. the foam resulting from excessive sweating (as on a horse)
2. beat severely with a whip or rod;
4. rub soap all over, usually with the purpose of cleaning

auth_sentence.content: Take rag and soap lather up over entire body.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Take rag and soap lather up over entire body.

auth_sentence.content: Leaves skin feeling clean, with a clean refreshing lather.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Leaves skin feeling clean, with a clean refreshing lather.

auth_sentence.content: It didn't lather too much just the right amount.
auth_sentence.res_content: It didn't lather too much just the right amount.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It didn't lather too much just the right amount.

means.word_mean: (尤指不必要地)焦躁不安，发怒

sentences.en: Look, don’t worry! There’s no point getting yourself into a lather over this!
sentences.cn: 嘿，别担心，为这事生气不值得。

sentences.en: What’s going on? Chris has just come rushing into my office all in a lather, saying something about a lost report.
sentences.cn: 发生什么事了？刚才克里斯神情紧张地冲进我的办公室，说什么报告不见了。
